page.title: 11MAYPOLE DANCING IN STOCKPORT
page.content: { Maypole dancing}at S.Paul's School. Maypole dancing used to be a popular dance to celebrate the return of Spring. It is rarely seen now and we are lucky to have Mrs Taylor to teach us. We start practicing after Easter and on{Mayday}we put on a display for visitors. Our Maypole is a strong wooden pole just over 4m high with a metal base to weight it down.The top spins round and has 16 long coloured ribbons attached to it which are held by the dancers. The easiest dance is the Barber's Pole.First the boys stand still and the girls go round one way. Then the girls stand still and the boys go round the other way. You do this five times and then change direction. Tricky dances are Spider's Web and Gypsy's Tent. Hardest of all is Weaving where lovely patterns are made down the pole.
